questions.question: What is matter?
options: Anything that has mass and occupies space
questions.explanation: Matter is anything that has mass and occupies space.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a state of matter?
questions.explanation: Energy is not a state of matter.

questions.question: Which state of matter has a definite shape and volume?
questions.explanation: Solids have definite shape and volume.

questions.question: Which state of matter takes the shape of its container but has a definite volume?
questions.explanation: Liquids take the shape of the container but have definite volume.

questions.question: Which state of matter has neither definite shape nor definite volume?
questions.explanation: Gases have neither definite shape nor definite volume.

questions.question: What is the smallest unit of matter?
questions.explanation: Atom is the smallest unit of matter.

questions.question: What is the process of changing a solid directly into a gas called?
questions.explanation: Sublimation is the process where a solid changes directly into a gas.

questions.question: What is the process of changing a liquid into a gas called?
questions.explanation: Evaporation is the process of changing a liquid into a gas.

questions.question: What is the process of changing a gas into a liquid called?
questions.explanation: Condensation is the process of changing a gas into a liquid.

questions.question: What is the process of changing a solid into a liquid called?
questions.explanation: Melting is the process of changing a solid into a liquid.

questions.question: Which state of matter has the highest kinetic energy?
questions.explanation: Particles in gases have the highest kinetic energy.

questions.question: Which state of matter is compressible?
questions.explanation: Gases are compressible.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of sublimation?
questions.explanation: Camphor sublimes directly from solid to gas.

questions.question: What is the boiling point of water at sea level?
questions.explanation: Water boils at 100°C at sea level.

questions.question: What is the freezing point of water?
questions.explanation: Water freezes at 0°C.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT matter?
questions.explanation: Light is not matter.

questions.question: Which of the following is a mixture?
questions.explanation: Air is a mixture of gases.

questions.question: Which of the following is a pure substance?
questions.explanation: Distilled water is a pure substance.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a property of solids?
questions.explanation: Solids are not easily compressible.

questions.question: Which of the following is a property of liquids?
options: Take the shape of the container
questions.explanation: Liquids take the shape of the container.

questions.question: Which of the following is a property of gases?
questions.explanation: Gases have no definite shape or volume.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a change of state?
questions.explanation: Rusting is a chemical change, not a change of state.

questions.question: Which of the following is a chemical change?
questions.explanation: Burning of paper is a chemical change.

questions.question: Which of the following is a physical change?
questions.explanation: Melting of ice is a physical change.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a physical property?
questions.explanation: Flammability is a chemical property.

questions.question: Which of the following is a chemical property?
questions.explanation: Ability to burn is a chemical property.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a mixture?
questions.explanation: Distilled water is a pure substance.

questions.question: Which of the following is a homogeneous mixture?
questions.explanation: Salt solution is homogeneous.

questions.question: Which of the following is a heterogeneous mixture?
questions.explanation: Sand and iron filings are heterogeneous.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a method of separation?
questions.explanation: Combustion is not a separation method.
